docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 Two top Government leaders were in sharp disagreement here today over the reasons why the United States Alliance for Progress had not been able to function in Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 14 Two top Government leaders were in sharp disagreement here today over the reasons why the United States Alliance for Progress had not been able to function in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Ex-Pres Haedo denounces US for lag in Alliance for Progress aid; ex-Pres Nardone disputes him; blames 'dictatorial' rule and inaction of Parliament; delayed programs discussed

headline.main: U.S. AID LAG STIRS URUGUAY DISPUTE; Leaders Criticize Washington and Own Parliament

docs.snippet: Election campaign begins; Alliance for Progress among issues noted; US blames delays on Parliament failure to pass enabling legis

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--A spatter of political sniping followed by a salvo has served notice in the last few days that a typical Uruguayan election campaign is under way.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--A spatter of political sniping followed by a salvo has served notice in the last few days that a typical Uruguayan election campaign is under way.

headline.main: URUGUAYANS OPEN BITTER CAMPAIGN; Leaders Fight One Another as Well as the Opposition

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 16--Uruguay is doing brisk business with the Soviet Union this year in her campaign for new markets. She may expand her trade with other Communist-bloc countries, including mainland China.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 16--Uruguay is doing brisk business with the Soviet Union this year in her campaign for new markets. She may expand her trade with other Communist-bloc countries, including mainland China.

headline.main: URUGUAY SEEKING RED-BLOC TRADE; Pressed by Competition, She Wants New Markets Earlier Accord Collapsed Competition Stiffening

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; FREE CURRENCY RATES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--Uruguay, in a "letter of intention" to the International Monetary Fund, is looking forward to major change in foreign trade regulations and the dropping of internal subsides.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 15--Uruguay, in a "letter of intention" to the International Monetary Fund, is looking forward to major change in foreign trade regulations and the dropping of internal subsides.
docs.abstract: Govt plans major changes in trade rules and dropping of certain trade levies in return for IMF stand-by credit to support currency

headline.main: URUGUAY PLANS REVISED ECONOMY; Changes Would Facilitate Aid by Monetary Fund Domestic Effect Noted

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ROME, June 18 (AP) Angel Gabriel Borlenghi, Minister of the Interior under President Juan D. Peron of Argentina, died here yesterday of a heart ailment at the age of 58. He had been living in Rome as an exile since last October.
docs.lead_paragraph: ROME, June 18 (AP) Angel Gabriel Borlenghi, Minister of the Interior under President Juan D. Peron of Argentina, died here yesterday of a heart ailment at the age of 58. He had been living in Rome as an exile since last October.
